intro: Xanthosia scopulicola, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. It has a low-growing habit with narrow, linear leaves. Xanthosia scopulicola is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species in harsh conditions.
